article.class: post-6 page type-page status-publish has-post-thumbnail hentry

div.h1: All DVISD Schools Will Remain Closed Through The 2019-2020 Academic Year.

h6.strong: In compliance with the order announced by Governor Greg Abbott, Del Valle ISD will remain closed for the remainder of the 2019-2020 academic year. The health and safety of our students, families, and staff remains our top priority.

The closure includes cancellation of all extracurricular activities, athletics, after school programs, and events. During the closure of schools, Del Valle ISD will follow an Alternate Learning Plan. Click below for more information.

div.p: Central Texas Food Bank is providing emergency relief food distributions at Del Valle High School on April 20 from 9am-12 pm. The distribution will operate as a drive-thru with pre-packed boxes that will be loaded directly into your vehicle’s trunk.

div.div: DVISD is adopting a Rubric Grading System for the remainder of the school closure. Click for more deatils about current PK-8 and 9-12 Grading Policies.

p.strong: During the district school closure, please call the main phone number of any school for assistance or click for campus and district contact directories.

div.class: et_pb_slide et_pb_slide_0 et_pb_bg_layout_light et_pb_slide_with_image et_pb_media_alignment_center et-pb-active-slide

div.div: Del Valle ISD serves over 11,000 students on 16 campuses and works to do “Whatever It Takes” for their students. The district’s official mascot is the cardinal and the colors are true red and white.

div.p: The Mission of Del Valle ISD, the fearless educational leader that binds a growing and progressive community, is to empower and inspire our students to be world-class visionaries who navigate challenges and think critically as valued, productive contributors and socially responsible leaders in a diverse, global society through: a commitment to our beliefs, innovative practices, and the collaborative efforts of all stakeholders.

div.div: Del Valle ISD is located in Southeast Travis County and serves the communities of Austin, Garfield, Creedmoor, Mustang Ridge, Elroy, Pilot Knob, Webberville, and Hornsby Bend.
